<translate><!--T:1--> '''ApiSandbox''' lets developers experiment with the {{<tvar name=1>ll|API:Main page</tvar>|MediaWiki API}} in a browser form.</translate>
<translate><!--T:6--> It was inspired by a <tvar name=1>{{ll|Google Summer of Code}}</tvar> proposal by <tvar name=2>[[User:Salil|Salil P. A.]]</tvar>.</translate>

<translate>
== Usage == <!--T:2-->
</translate>
<translate><!--T:3--> On a wiki with ApiSandbox installed, go to <tvar name=1><code>Special:ApiSandbox</code></tvar>.</translate>
<translate><!--T:7--> Choose action, format and other parameters.</translate>
<translate><!--T:8--> The sandbox displays interactive help for every request parameter.</translate>
<translate><!--T:9--> Then click the "<tvar name=1>{{int|apisandbox-submit}}</tvar>" button.</translate>
<translate><!--T:10--> ApiSandbox makes the request to <tvar name=1><code>api.php</code></tvar> on your behalf and displays the result below in the format you chose.</translate>
<translate><!--T:11--> You can copy the request URL (and POST data, if needed) for reuse.</translate>

<translate>
<!--T:4-->
You can preload ApiSandbox form parameters by putting the query string to <tvar name=3><code>api.php</code></tvar> in the URL fragment, for example the query <tvar name=1><code>/w/api.php?action=languagesearch&search=Maratih&typos=1</code></tvar> becomes <tvar name=2>[{{fullurl:Special:ApiSandbox}}#action=languagesearch&format=json&search=Maratih&typos=1 Special:ApiSandbox#action=languagesearch&format=json&search=Maratih&typos=1]</tvar>.

<!--T:5-->
Note that, despite it being called a sandbox, any write requests performed with this extension ''will'' modify the wiki.
</translate>
